title: Causal Inference in Statistics: A Primer
abstract: Accessible primer introducing counterfactuals and graphical reasoning with back-door adjustment.

title: Causality: Models, Reasoning and Inference (2nd ed.)
abstract: Foundational text formalizing structural causal models, do-calculus, and identification criteria.

title: Causal Inference: What If
abstract: Comprehensive modern textbook on counterfactuals, identifiability, and longitudinal methods.

title: Mostly Harmless Econometrics: An Empiricist’s Companion
abstract: Practical guide to IV, RD, DiD with empirical applications in economics.

title: Elements of Causal Inference: Foundations and Learning Algorithms
abstract: Bridges causality and machine learning; emphasizes invariance and causal discovery.

title: Causal diagrams for empirical research
abstract: Introduces DAGs for empirical research; formalizes back-door/front-door criteria.

title: Direct and indirect effects
abstract: Formal treatment of mediation analysis via potential outcomes and path-specific effects.

title: On the application of the Neyman–Rubin causal model
abstract: Seminal development of potential outcomes framework for causal effects.

title: The central role of the propensity score in observational studies
abstract: Introduces propensity score methods for reducing bias in observational studies.

title: Identification and Estimation of Local Average Treatment Effects
abstract: Defines LATE under IV assumptions; cornerstone for modern IV applications.

title: Does compulsory school attendance affect schooling and earnings?
abstract: Famous IV study using quarter of birth as an instrument for schooling.

title: Minimum wages and employment: A case study of the fast-food industry
abstract: Iconic DiD study evaluating minimum wage effects on employment in New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: Regression Discontinuity Designs: A Guide to Practice
abstract: Practical guide to RD design, estimation, and validity checks.

title: Identification using regression discontinuity designs
abstract: Formal identification results and estimation for sharp and fuzzy RD designs.

title: On the failure of economic models to identify causality
abstract: Early critique leading to g-methods; introduces structural nested models and g-computation.

title: Marginal structural models and causal inference in epidemiology
abstract: Introduces MSMs for longitudinal data with time-varying confounding.

title: Instrumental Variables Methods for the Correlation between Schooling and Earnings
abstract: Classic IV application exploring returns to education with strong identification discussion.

title: Weak Instruments and Weak Identification in Generalized Method of Moments
abstract: Diagnostics and theory for weak instruments; critical for reliable IV estimation.

title: Two-Stage Least Squares Estimation with Weak Instruments
abstract: Robust inference in the presence of weak instrumental variables.

title: A Unified Approach to Interpreting Model Predictions
abstract: While not causal, SHAP interpretability is often paired with heterogeneous effect models.

title: Double/Debiased Machine Learning for Treatment and Structural Parameters
abstract: DML with cross-fitting and Neyman orthogonality for robust causal estimation.

title: Recursive partitioning for heterogeneous causal effects
abstract: Introduces causal trees for estimating heterogeneous treatment effects.
venue: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

title: Estimation and inference of heterogeneous treatment effects using random forests
abstract: Causal forests with asymptotic theory for CATE estimation.
venue: Journal of the American Statistical Association

title: Meta-learners for estimating heterogeneous treatment effects
abstract: T-, S-, and X-learners as flexible baselines for CATE with ML models.

title: Counterfactual inference and representation learning
abstract: Representation balancing for counterfactual inference from observational data.

title: Estimating individual treatment effect: generalization bounds and algorithms
abstract: Theoretical and algorithmic analysis for estimating ITE/CATE with deep learning.

title: Learning representations for counterfactual inference
abstract: Autoencoders and deep architectures for uplift and counterfactual tasks.

title: Quasi-oracle estimation of heterogeneous treatment effects
abstract: R-learner framework with orthogonalization for robust CATE estimation.

title: Semiparametric theory for causal inference in modern settings
abstract: Unified view of doubly robust estimators and efficiency theory for causal functionals.

title: Policy learning with observational data
abstract: Off-policy evaluation and policy learning with ML estimators.

title: Uplift Modeling for Direct Marketing
abstract: Decision trees tailored for uplift modeling in marketing campaigns.

title: A policy learning perspective on learning to defer
abstract: Framework connecting policy learning and selective prediction/defer decisions.

title: Dehejia & Wahba re-examining LaLonde’s training data
abstract: Propensity score re-analysis of LaLonde’s job training data.
venue: Journal of the American Statistical Association

title: LaLonde’s evaluation of training programs
abstract: Experimental vs observational comparison in job training evaluations.

title: IHDP semi-synthetic benchmark for causal inference
abstract: Benchmark dataset and setup used for CATE evaluation.

title: An Introduction to Propensity Score Methods for Reducing the Effects of Confounding
abstract: Practical tutorial on propensity score methods in health research.

title: An Introduction to Mediation Analysis in Epidemiology
abstract: Accessible overview of mediation with sensitivity analysis in health contexts.

title: Confounding and collapsibility in causal inference
abstract: Clarifies confounding, collapsibility, and causal interpretation in epidemiology.

title: DoWhy: An End-to-End Library for Causal Inference
abstract: Unified Python library for identification, estimation, and refutation in causal inference.

title: EconML: A Python Package for ML-Based Heterogeneous Treatment Effects
abstract: Open-source package implementing DML, DR-Learner, and other policy/CATE estimators.

title: CausalML: A Python Package for Uplift and Causal Learning
abstract: Practical uplift and CATE methods used in marketing and personalization.

title: DoWhy-Graphical: PyWhy initiative for causal graphs
abstract: Graph-centric extensions and tooling under the PyWhy umbrella.

title: Separating association from causation in measurement of effects
abstract: Philosophical and statistical discussion on causation vs association.
venue: Journal of the American Statistical Association

title: The Do-Calculus Revisited
abstract: Properties of causal calculus and identifiability in graphical models.

title: Causation, Prediction, and Search
abstract: Foundational text on constraint-based causal discovery algorithms (PC, FCI).

title: Causal discovery with equal variance assumption (LiNGAM)
abstract: Linear non-Gaussian acyclic models enabling identifiable causal directions.

title: Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data (2nd ed.)
abstract: Comprehensive text on modern econometrics with causal emphasis.

title: Generalized Method of Moments
abstract: GMM framework underpinning many causal estimators in econometrics.

title: Testing for overidentifying restrictions (Sargan test)
abstract: Classical test used in IV/GMM for instrument validity.

title: Some Tests of Specification for Panel Data: Monte Carlo Evidence and an Application
abstract: Dynamic panel GMM methods with broad empirical use.

title: Orthogonal statistical learning
abstract: Orthogonalization ideas for robust estimation with ML nuisance models.

title: Balancing neural networks for treatment effect estimation
abstract: Neural methods for covariate balance in causal effect estimation.

title: Causal effect inference with deep latent-variable models
abstract: Deep generative modeling for counterfactual estimation with latent confounding.

title: Generalized random forests
abstract: Forest-based estimators for a variety of quantities including quantiles and CATE.

title: Heterogeneous treatment effect estimation via deep learning
abstract: Neural architectures for CATE estimation with regularization and overlap considerations.

title: G-formula and causal inference in longitudinal studies
abstract: Foundational g-computation method for longitudinal causal effects.

title: Targeted maximum likelihood estimation (TMLE)
abstract: Doubly robust, efficient estimators with built-in cross-validation.

title: Explanation in causal inference: methods for mediation and interaction
abstract: Extensive treatment of mediation, interaction, and sensitivity in health contexts.

title: Seven rules of thumb for A/B testing
abstract: Classic practitioner guidance for online controlled experiments.

title: Practical guide to controlled experiments on the web
abstract: Industry best practices for designing, running, and analyzing online experiments.

title: Trustworthy online controlled experiments: A practical guide to A/B testing
abstract: Book covering end-to-end online experimentation at scale.

title: The Design of Experiments
abstract: Foundational text introducing randomized experiments and analysis of variance.

title: On the application of sample survey theory (Neyman 1923)
abstract: Potential outcomes framework origins; randomized experiments and average causal effect.

title: Causal impact from a Bayesian structural time-series model
abstract: Time-series counterfactuals for measuring intervention impact.

title: Difference-in-differences with staggered adoption
abstract: Decomposition of two-way fixed effects DiD with staggered treatment timing.

title: A practical introduction to difference-in-differences
abstract: Tutorial covering identification and pitfalls in DiD designs.

title: Sensitivity analysis for instrumental variables
abstract: Robustness and partial identification under violations of IV assumptions.

title: Generalized synthetic control method
abstract: Synthetic control extension for panel data with multiple treated units.

title: The synthetic control method for comparative case studies
abstract: Introduces synthetic control for policy evaluation.
venue: Journal of the American Statistical Association

title: The Cream Skimming Problem in Experiments
abstract: Pitfalls in online experiments; external validity issues.

title: Practical recommendations for bandits in product experiments
abstract: Guidelines for multi-armed bandits in web experiments.

title: The Book of Why
abstract: Popular science book explaining causal ideas to a broad audience.

title: Matching Methods for Causal Inference: A Review and a Look Forward
abstract: Comprehensive review of matching methods and practical considerations.

title: Regression discontinuity designs: Theory and applications
abstract: Survey of RD design and applications across economics.

title: The generalized propensity score and dose-response estimation
abstract: Extends propensity scores to continuous treatments for dose-response estimation.

title: Sensitivity analysis for unmeasured confounding in observational studies
abstract: Bounds and methods for assessing robustness to hidden bias.
venue: Annual Review of Statistics and Its Application

title: Do-Calculus and conditional independence in SCMs
abstract: Graph separation, conditional independence, and do-calculus properties.

title: The Stable Unit Treatment Value Assumption (SUTVA)
abstract: Discussion and formalization of SUTVA in potential outcomes.
venue: Journal of the American Statistical Association

title: Explain then predict: Interpretable causal learning
abstract: Interpretable models for decision-making with causal considerations.

title: An introduction to instrumental variables for health economists
abstract: Tutorial on IV methods tailored for health applications.
